content: What does #![feature(staged)] do? It's only present in a single test file, and I can't find a definition in the compiler, let alone its purpose. The file in question is src/test/ui/rfc-2632-const-trait-impl/staged-api.rs
It apparently alters behavior and is emitted as a "help" in an error message, but I've no idea where that's coming from.
I think it is defined in the staged_api auxiliary test crate.
I think it is defined in the staged_api auxiliary test crate.
Ah, I assumed it was a language feature so I didn't even grep for that pattern. Makes sense as to what I need to do now. Thank you!
